sub_title: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!
summary:
I am a versatile professional (T-Shaped) with 20+ years of technology and consulting experience. During this time I have fulfilled a number of various roles. This with a strong passion for Coaching, Business Development, Managing Director, Manager, Managing Change and (complex) Programs or Projects in innovative environments, and where business development is paramount. Known as someone with a strong will and great drive, the combination of experience, insight, communication skills and a results-oriented style of work makes me ideal to carry out programs and leading organizational transformations on a global scale. As an enthusiastic worker with a motivating personality, a good sense of humor, I can work well on my own or in a team. I am goal-orientated, focused on quality, effectively gets the job done and I am an energetic contributor to any program. 

Happy to connect!

Specialties: Strategic Consultancy, Cloud, Azure, Cloud Center of Excellence, CI/CD, Infra as Code, Containers, O365, Windows10, AWS, Agile (Official MSFT Agile Coach), Scrum (Master), IT integrator, PSM, PSPO, KanBan, SAFe, DevOps, Disruption, Change and Adoption, Prosci Foundation and Change Practitioner, Agile Project & Program Management, Transition and Transformation Management, Delivery Management,  Enterprise Service Management Coach, Inspirator, Enabling people, Growth Mindset, Inclusive, Pragmatic, Brand & Marketing Strategies, Storytelling, Creative Problem Solver, Execution (Getting Things Done), Engagement, Leadership (Lead by Example), Taking Ownership and making new ideas relevant for businesses and consumers.

awards.title: Spark Award
awards.description: The Microsoft Consultancy Services - Spark Award recognizes and celebrates cross-functional teams who demonstrate exceptional collaboration and partnership, working together across Microsoft to drive the right outcomes for our customers.

awards.title: Spot Award (Secure Infrastructure Domain)
awards.description: The SPOT awards will showcase teams that go above and beyond to drive successful important and highly strategic initiative outcomes based on the formal area of Services focus.

awards.title: Better Together Award (Secure Infrastructure Domain)
awards.description:
The #BetterTogether awards will showcase teams that go above and beyond to drive successful business outcomes based on the Microsoft Services FY19 Business Priorities using one or more of the Microsoft cultural attributes. These are teams who make extraordinary contributions to the business, translating our goals into real world successes. 

This award is related to being part of the CCoE incubation team and being one of the drivers of the concept which led into realeasing a World Wide offering.

awards.title: Better Together Award (Western Europe Services)
awards.description:
The #BetterTogether awards will showcase teams that go above and beyond to drive successful business outcomes based on the Microsoft Services FY19 Business Priorities using one or more of the Microsoft cultural attributes. This award is related to being part of the ABN Amro Azure CCoE & Unified Support team.

awards.title: Star Award (Dutch Subsidiary)

The Star award recognizes and rewards individuals within Microsoft Digital, Services, and Success who make key contributions to the organization which make the difference to the success of Microsoft Digital, Services, and Success and WE Services!

This award is related to the ABN AMRO BANK and Rabobank CCoE engagements.

awards.title: CPE Champion Award (Microsoft Worldwide Enterprise Services Delivery)
awards.description:
The Champion awards recognizes the exceptional commitment of individuals and teams who embody the Microsoft culture and drive business outcomes. 

CPE Champions achieve this by demonstrating extraordinary results and exceptional commitment to customer and partner satisfaction, while supporting the WW Customer & Partner Experience (CPE).

This award is related to the ABN AMRO Bank 4-2-1 engagement.

projects.title: Microsoft - Cloud Center of Excellence: Global Offering
projects.description:
As Chief PO (Program Manager) I’m responsible for managing multiple Cloud Center of Excellence engagements in the Netherlands and supporting others. Which are the first ones in the world ever executed based on this underlying concept. Direct result of this success has led into international interest and sales of which I'm part as SME or respective Agile PjM.  

I’m thrilled being involved and responsible for ensuring that recommended practices and development guidelines are leveraged and are used in delivering a worldwide CCoE offering including the related Consultant Delivery Guidebook and Bootcamp IP. Which will change the way how customers adopt a Cloud Native Way of Working and leads to a new state of affairs on a global scale!

The Cloud Center of Excellence solution helps the customer build a modern IT organization that follows an Agile approach to capture business requirements, uses reusable deployment packages that align with security, compliance and service management policies and maintains a functional Azure landing platform in alignment with operational procedures.

Version 2.0 - Which is a more product centric approach.
Version 1.2 - Is the evolution of the initial CCoE offering including other Microsoft Offerings.
Version 1.0 - Official Global Offering has gone live on 14-01-2019.
Version 1.0 - Beta has gone live on 01-12-2018.

Version 0.5 - Pilot has gone live on 11-10-2018.

projects.title: Volvo Car Company - Cloud Modernization: DC exit

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Gelre - Cloud Modernization: DC exit
projects.description:
The privately-owned hospital, Gelre Ziekenhuizen (Gelre), has an objective to increase the primary production. During this process, Gelre has identified the space used by the two onsite datacenters as a source to increase production. Gelre has asked Microsoft to deliver a proposal for a program with the objective of reclaiming one of the onsite datacenters by leveraging Microsoft Azure instead. 

In this program, Microsoft will migrate Applications currently hosted in Gelre’s on-premises datacenters to Microsoft Azure. In addition to the migration, which is the core part of the program, Microsoft will support Gelre to design and prepare the Microsoft Azure Infrastructure for migrations.

As Microsoft Agile Program Manager I’m responsible for governing the respective workstreams and provide a framework to effectively and efficiently manage each Workstream.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: ASML - Cloud Center of Excellence: Phase 3
projects.description:
ASML desires to adopt Azure and operate Azure using efficient, cost effective, and agile service structures. 

During Phase 1 (which started in January 2019) and 2, Microsoft will help ASML set up the Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) as a joint ASML - Microsoft program. The program is independent of existing ASML operations. 

The CCoE needs a solid Azure cloud and DevOps foundation (people, processes, and technology). Microsoft conducted a foundational gap analysis to evaluate the level of remediation needed to achieve CCoE program scope based on our standard Hybrid Cloud Foundation services offering guidance. Microsoft assists with the deployment of the level of Azure functionality and DevOps tooling needed to address findings from gap analysis.

As CPO (Agile Program Manager) I must ensure that during the execution of the project’s phase 3 we transition all roles to the customer, to ensure they can successfully continue with the CCoE after Microsoft leaves.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Belfius - Cloud Center of Excellence: Foundation and Phase 1 (Lead Phase)
projects.description:
Belfius is undertaking a multi-year Core Banking Renewal (CBR) program which provides an opportunity for Belfius to replace its legacy, traditional IT models, with more efficient, cost effective, and agile service structures. The CBR program intends to setup new core-banking applications on the Azure platform using 
an Agile DevOps approach. 

The joint mission statement for the Belfius CCoE is:  “Set up, provide and encourage the adoption of transformational capabilities within the domains of infrastructure, operations and development so that Belfius has the maturity to host mission critical banking applications and corresponding confidential data in a hybrid-cloud setup (on-prem, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) in a cost effective, secure, compliant, resilient and future-proof manner that also facilitates improved time to market”.

As CCoE SME I’m tasked to support and guide Belfius in the successful set-up of a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE), as a joint Belfius-Microsoft program, to realize this mission.
 
The Cloud Center of Excellence will be used to help Belfius build a modern IT organization, which follows an agile approach to capturing business requirements, uses reusable deployment packages that align with security, compliance, and service management policies and maintains a functional Azure landing platform that aligns with operational procedures. This program will be independent of existing Belfius operations, but at the same time it will become an integral and standard part of Belfius’ organization.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: ABN AMRO BANK - Cloud Center of Excellence: CBSP Phase 5
projects.description:
ABN AMRO Bank’s strategy is to move their application landscape too the Cloud. To enable this initiative, AAB decided to setup a Cloud Based Service Platform - Azure Cloud Competence Center and has asked Microsoft to assist them in the preparation and deployment by using Microsoft’s experience in doing this with other large customers. The CBSP Azure Cloud Competence Center will help increase organizational agility and support Business Innovation. Also, it will demonstrate the value of using Cloud platforms and it will increase the experience and transformation towards DevOps. 

As Interim CPO (Agile Program Manager) I’m responsible for ensuring that recommended practices and development guidelines are leveraged and to continue the participation in the CBSP Azure Cloud Competence Center for AAB and my successor is enabled to deliver the same value as in past 4 years. 

Within the setup of phase 5 there’s a joined responsibility between AAB and Microsoft for providing overall direction and control of the project team and its activities, managing the project schedule and estimates, and for overall project success.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: ABN AMRO BANK - Cloud Center of Excellence (CBSP):
projects.description:
ABN AMRO Bank’s strategy is to move their application landscape too the Cloud. To enable this initiative, AAB decided to setup a Cloud Based Service Platform - Azure Cloud Competence Center and has asked Microsoft to assist them in the preparation and deployment by using  Microsoft’s experience in doing this with other large customers. The CBSP Azure Cloud Competence Center will help increase organizational agility and support Business Innovation. Also, it will demonstrate the value of using Cloud platforms and it will increase the experience and transformation towards DevOps. The Value of the Azure Cloud Competence Center services: 

- Demonstrate and realize the agility and innovation that Cloud potentially offers;
- Avoid the common pitfalls and use Industry Best Practices; 
- Optimize Service Management and Operations with Cloud Principles
- Maximize re-use and standardization on Cloud-based workloads
- Demonstrate and realize that ABN AMRO is always ‘In Control’ when using Public Cloud.

When I joined the program they had landed upon phase 2 of the program. In which Microsoft continues providing Subject Matter Experts, in the form of a Core Team and a Flexible Team. The Azure Cloud Competence Centre is a multi-disciplinary team, consisting of ABN AMRO and Microsoft resources. Which support up to 5 teams/workloads simultaneously and is integrated within AAB’s way of working and the methodologies (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) AAB uses.

As Agile Project Manager I’m responsible for ensuring that recommended practices and development guidelines are leveraged and to continue the participation in the CBSP Azure Cloud Competence Center for AAB . 

Within the setup of phase 2, 3  and 4 there’s a joined responsibility  between AAB and Microsoft for providing overall direction and control of the project team and its activities, managing the project schedule and estimates, and for overall project success.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Rabobank - Cloud Center of Excellence:
projects.description:
Rabobank’s strategy is to move their application landscape too the Cloud. To enable this initiative, Rabobank decided to setup a Cloud Based Service Platform - Azure Cloud Center of Excellence and has asked Microsoft to assist them in the preparation and deployment in a way that it helps create the most business value, while staying in control by using Microsoft’s experience in doing this with other large customers.

The main objective of this project is the implementation of scalable, automated and certified Cloud services and providing input for setting up the line organization for Azure by means of: recommended practices, job descriptions, and our cloud operating model. Rabobank has the goal of transferring the obtained services towards the line organization. With the aim of having The Rabobank Azure CCoE help increase organizational agility and support Business Innovation. Also, it will demonstrate the value of using Cloud platforms and it will increase the experience and transformation towards DevOps. The Value of the Azure CCoE services: 

- Demonstrate and realize the agility and innovation that Cloud potentially offers;
- Maximize re-use and standardization on Cloud-based workloads
- Demonstrate and realize that Rabobank is always ‘In Control’ when using Public Cloud

As Chief PO (Agile Program Manager) I’m responsible for ensuring that recommended practices and development guidelines are leveraged and to continue the participation in Rabobank’s CCoE. In which Microsoft provides SME’s, in the form of a Core Team, a flexible team and where we will lead and drive the implementation and actively transfer knowledge to the Rabobank team. The CCoE is a multi-disciplinary team, consisting of Rabobank and Microsoft resources. Which support up to 74 (to date) teams/workloads simultaneously and is integrated within Rabobank’s way of working and methodologies (Agile) Rabobank uses in order to achieve three overall EPIC’s (phase 1 and 2).

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Tata Steel - Cloud Center of Excellence:
projects.description:
As Interim Chief Product Owner (Agile Program Manager) I am tasked with helping Tata Steel IJmuiden B.V. IT organization to deliver a Cloud Broker function which facilitates the demand for leveraging public cloud services by business development teams within Tata Steel.

Instead of leaving the business development teams on their own to discover what cloud services to use and how to implement those services in compliance with Tata Steel policies, Tata Steel has decided to facilitate this through a Tata Steel Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE).

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Shell - Azure Information Protection:
projects.description:
Shell has asked Microsoft to prepare and deploy Microsoft Azure Information Protection using the Microsoft Services Azure Information Protection Implementation Service Offer along with a design for HYOK for sensitive documents. This solution provides data protection capabilities that can help Shell classify, label, and protect sensitive information. The purpose of this project is to provide Shell with a design which enables the implementation of the core information protection capabilities of Microsoft’s Azure, define a classification and labeling strategy, and define a data-loss prevention strategy.

Therefore as the Microsoft Project Manager I am responsible for:

•	To pilot Azure Information Protection capabilities that can help you manually protect your data. For example, you can use these capabilities to control who can open certain Microsoft Office documents. You can also restrict email forwarding.

•	To define a classification and labeling strategy for the organization. Such a strategy can give you the ability to perform automatic data protection that is based on content type. For example, you will be able to detect that credit card information has been entered into a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet and automatically classify, label, and help protect that spreadsheet.

•	To define a data-loss prevention strategy. This can help you keep certain types of information from leaving your organization. For example, if someone attempts to send an email about a sensitive project to someone outside the company, a data-loss prevention policy could prevent the message from being sent.

•	To define a strategy to protect a small subset of documents and emails with a key that is hosted on-premises with “Hold your own Key” (HYOK).  This might be required for regulatory and compliance reasons, but also for top secret data that should not leave Shell premises.

•	To define Shell Use Cases along with feasibility within Azure Information Protection.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Achmea - Advanced Threat Analytics:
projects.description:
Today, the topic of cyber-security has moved from IT and the datacenter to the highest levels of the boardroom. Attacks and threats have grown substantially more sophisticated in frequency and severity. Attackers reside within a network an average of eight months before they are even detected. In the vast majority of attacks, they compromise user credentials and they are increasingly using legitimate IT tools rather than malware. 

You are now working under the assumption of a breach. How do you find the attackers—before they cause damage? 

Therefor Achmea’s strategy is to further increase their security measurements. To enable this initiative, Achmea decided to implement ATA (Advanced Threat Analytics) and has asked Microsoft to assist them in the preparation and deployment by using the Microsoft Services ATAIS (Implementation Services). This ATA implementation will be used to monitor Achmea’s AD DS for potential threats and to provide advice about, and help creating, a response plan that is specific to events that ATA detects.

Deploying a threat detection solution requires an organization to have a solid understanding of the threats that such a solution can detect and be appropriately prepared to respond.

Therefore as the Microsoft Project Manager I am responsible for:

•	Provide Achmea with an understanding of the threats for which ATA can provide detection services.
•	Assist with the creation of a response plan specific to the events that ATA might identify.
•	Assist with the prepare, design and deployment of ATA to monitor for threats to Achmea’s production Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) environment.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: NATO - Interim Program Manager:
projects.description:
At NATO we have wide variety of active engagements (Staff Augmentation and Projects) and multi domain oriented. Therefore as the Microsoft Program Manager I am responsible for:

•	     Cross domain oversight on all active engagements, ensuring alignment with Project Managers (PjMs) of the respective engagements in order to have cohesive overview.

•	Equip NATO AAD with a comprehensive executive overview & reporting of project status, engagement consumption, … in order to communicate towards NATO executives.

•	Support the NATO AAD in preparing governance and consolidated reporting and meetings and participate where appropriate.

•	Drive and facilitate the shaping of the delivery (incl resourcing FTE/subco) of engagements with the respective domains in order to conclude finally together with the NATO AAD.

•	Escalation management of ongoing delivery within the Domains and assigned PjMs.

•	Close collaboration with NATO AAD in order to identify and concretize on upsell opportunities and/or change requests within ongoing delivery.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: ABN AMRO BANK - 4-2-1:
projects.description:
As part of ABN AMRO’s TOPS2020 initiative the 4-2-1 program is one of the top five and important enablers to support the speed of ABN AMROs Digital Ambition, realizing the use of a standardized environment, guarantee continuity, enable a higher level of security and prevent extra operational costs. The objective of the 421 User Migration project at ABN AMRO is to migrate 37.000 user accounts in scope globally and registered in the corresponding Active Directories to the target Active Directory. As the Microsoft Program Manager within this Transition & Transformation, I am responsible for building upon the existing migration projects at ABN AMRO (in a combined Agile / Waterfall method) and the project called 4-2-1 User Migration. Which consists of three streams:

Governance and Architecture
Active Directory Migration Service (ADMS residing in Azure)
User Support

When you implement changes like the 4-2-1 program, you must ensure we use the right people to help guide the employees through the change and is an essential element of a transition like this. On top of that leverage existing IP plus existing scripts for application remediation already created, augmented by the creation and execution of new scripts that are required for applications that are not remediated yet to ensure continued user access to application databases that require database changes during run time of the migration, manage the projects/programs where we have a dependency and closely monitor the impact which might be caused by the organizational changes.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

This ATA implementation will be used to monitor ABN Amro’s AD DS for potential threats and to provide advice about, and help creating, a response plan that is specific to events that ATA detects.

projects.title: BHP Billiton - MPOS
projects.description: In this Phase of the Project we will implement the equipment to enable the test environment to be setup on Virtual Machines within the BHP Marketing environment in Maidstone in line with the current VM test bed currently build at Quorom’s site accessed via Citrix. We will test capability of Quorum to be accessed via Dynamic desktop removing Citrix dependency for access. We will also produce the infrastructure design to meet the specifications defined by Quorum with regards to the applications technical capabilities in handling fault tolerance and required capacity as defined to them in the BHP Billiton scope requirements.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Pon Holdings - Go Google
projects.description:
At the start of 2011 Pon Holdings decided to be one of the first companies to go "Google". This program migrates 240 branches to the Google Business Application Platform. 

As project manager within this transformation project, I am responsible for the Inventory and Analysis of branches - spread over 56 locations globally - as well as support during and after migration. The result of this activity is an impact assessment for each branch that allows PON to determine whether to mitigate or implement a permanent solution to ensure that the branch can move to the Google platform. 

I manage a project team consisting of 20 FTE's. Apart from the main project deliverables I set up a process of continuous improvement that leads to an increasingly optimized approach and well documented reusable project, support and helpdesk processes. This ensures a smooth transition of 12000 Pon users to the new Google email, calendar and docs environment.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Dutch Railways - Build 9
projects.description:
Dutch Railways has decided to upgrade their current "build 9" environment to the latest "build 10" environment in preparation for the future workplace. This program is responsible for ensuring that seven business units across The Netherlands are migrated to a new Microsoft Windows 7 based environment. 

As project manager within this transformation project, I am responsible for coordinating the technical and functional testing of over 600 applications and getting these either streamed or sequenced. Where required by the business I help to define their test cases and use case models. 

I manage a team consisting of approximately 30 FTE's. Apart from the main project deliverables I have set up a process of continuous improvement that leads to an increasingly optimized approach for the Application Publication Department, together with well documented and reusable processes for providing and maintaining clear overviews on status, progress and assigned tasks. This ensures a smooth transition of 7500 users to the new environment. The project team's ability to handle large volumes of work within very aggressive timescales grew significantly during a short period.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: Bombardier - Transition to LCC's
projects.description:
Bombardier Transportation outsources all global IT services to CSC This program brings an addition 7 countries across EMEA and Asia into the existing support model. 

As the main project manager and deputy to the transition manager within the transformation / transition project, I am responsible for the transition of all IT services (including network, servers and the applications residing on them) and AD migrations in six low cost countries into CSC Support. I manage a team consisting of approximately 20 FTEs. 

Apart from the main project deliverables I set up a process of continuous improvement that leads to an increasingly optimized approach and well documented reusable processes. This ensures a smooth transition of 2000 users and 100 servers to the new support organization. The project team's ability to handle a large volume of work grew significantly during a period of 4 months with very challenging timescales.

contributors.headline: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations - Empowering & Leading a highly skilled team of SME's!

projects.title: BHP Billiton - Valgrind
projects.description:
In 2009, BHP Billiton Marketing outsourced all global IT services to CSC. As a project manager within this transformation project, I am responsible for the implementation of complex application and infrastructure solutions in an international and politically charged environment. 

I have managed more than ten projects, including Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Solutions, Data Denter Consolidations, WAN infrastructure implementations, as well as Voice and Security solutions. 

During the project initiation phase I established a planning that created space for processes to be implemented and which lead to the smooth transition to the new organization. In addition,
communication with the client improved significantly. 

I manage project teams consisting of approximately 20 FTE's and with budgets varying between one hundred and four hundred thousand Euros.

profile_positions.description:
An IT Group Lead (GL) is a trusted Senior Executive Leadership role within ASML’s Core IT Management Team which is part of their IT Organization. 

As GL Infrastructure and Operations, I’m responsible for a fast-growing team comprised of 58 (direct) and 550 (indirect) highly skilled specialists operating in an Agile (SAFe) environment , providing them with thoughtful coaching, inspire, role readiness, career development and enrichment by improving and deepening their domain knowledge and technical skills (Security, D&AI, Cloud, modernization, platform (both on premise and Cloud) and Automation) Enabling them to become valuable members of high performing teams. 

Responsible of the overall global delivery and relationships for the customers my team is delivering value and making an impact across mission-critical and innovative IT services, driving intentional customer conversations to nurture deeper relationships and progress on their strategic objectives facilitating (Digital Transformation) the overall ASML envisioned ambitions and growth (times 2). 

Actively acting as Executive Steerco member and collaborating with the various leading coalitions of the respective ART, to drive towards continuous improvement, balance development with delivery of IT solutions ensuring the core IT portfolio of EPIC's is proactively managed and executed effectively, through portfolio management and delivery management, being accountable for budgeting, working with suppliers, customer satisfaction, portfolio health and areas of general interest to the team.

I’m also sponsor and leading several cross-team initiatives associated to Hybrid Cloud, Automation, Managed Services, DevOps, Skill improvements (Technical, Soft Skills, Leadership, Networking, Branding and Career Development plans), Mentoring and Coaching (Collaborate, Coach and Care), Community creation and building, Environmental, Social & Governance, Digital Transformation, and more)
profile_positions.title: IT Group Lead Infrastructure and Operations

profile_positions.description:
A Consulting Project Management Manager (CPMM) is a trusted Senior Leadership role within the Western Europe Management Team which is part of Microsoft's Enterprise Commercial Industry Delivery Solutions. 

I’m responsible for a team of 14 Consulting Project Managers (CPMs) within the EC ISD, providing them with thoughtful coaching, role readiness, career development and enrichment, responsible of the overall delivery and account relationship for the customer accounts my team is assigned and delivering, driving intentional customer conversations to nurture deeper relationships and progress opportunities. Actively acting as a customer Executive Steerco member. ensuring the project portfolio is proactively managed and executed effectively, through Practice Management (Planning, forecasting, governance and cost management), Delivery Management, being accountable of revenue, margin, consumption, customer satisfaction and portfolio health. 

Next to being a CPMM I’m also the Delivery Management Executive (DME) acting as a dedicated Durable Manager who is the relationship manager for strategic customers (11) within WE (The Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Finland) and owning the full ISD lifecycle (Pre-Sales, Portfolio and Strategic planning, Delivery Governance plus Financials and Contract Management) with accountability for Sales enablement, Executive presence, Project Success, Internal Orchestration, Consumption Expectations, Customer Outcomes and developing a deep relationship with the customer and account team.

I’m also Sponsor and leading several cross-team initiatives related to improving the onboarding experience, Upskilling (Technical, Soft Skills, Leadership, Networking, Branding and Career Development plans), Mentoring and Coaching (Model Coach and Care), Communities, Offering Development and Business Enhancement.
profile_positions.title: Manager - Consulting PjM Manager and DME (ISD - Enterprise Commercial Industry)

profile_positions.description:
A Technology Consulting Manager (TCM) is a trusted leadership role within the Western Europe Management Team which is part of Microsoft's Enterprise Commercial Industry Delivery Solutions. 

The TCM role consists of 3 parts.  As a TCM I’m leading an international team of highly skilled consultants (28) within Western Europe (The Netherlands, Spain, Italy, Portugal, Belgium, Ireland, Austria and Switzerland) to serve our Customers and drive successful consulting delivery execution through team preparedness, precision delivery, overall utilization and high customer/partner satisfaction in a cost-efficient manner. 

Along with my people management function, developing, mentoring and leading a high performing team of diverse consultants, I am the Country Business Manager (CBM) for Enterprise Commercial, overseeing the countries my team is based in, workforce and capacity planning, staffing forecast, being responsible for billable utilization targets, and revenue, efficiency, delivery quality and customer satisfaction related topics.

Next to being a TCM and CBM I’m also the Delivery Management Executive (DME) acting as a dedicated Durable Manager who is the relationship manager for specific customers (3) and owning the full ISD lifecycle with accountability for project success, consumption expectations, customer outcomes and developing a deep relationship with the customer and account team.

In addition I'm actively leading and sponsoring initiatives focused on Mentoring and Coaching (Model, Coach and Care), Upskilling (Technical and Soft skills) and Branding which enables the individuals and teams to develop and grow as a professional(s).
profile_positions.title: Manager - Technology Consulting Manager and DME (ISD - Enterprise Commercial Industry)

profile_positions.description:
A Technical Delivery Manager (TDM) is a trusted leadership role within the Azure Cloud and Artificial Intelligence Domain Management Team which is part of Microsoft's Cross Industry Delivery Solutions.  

The TDM role consists of 2 parts. As a TDM I'm leading a diverse team of highly skilled consultants (43 SME’s) within the Netherlands specializing in AC&AI. Which is covering the following technology pillars: 

  - Infrastructure
  - Security
  - Data &AI
  - Apps

As a Country Business Manager (CBM) I ensure and work closely together with the respective business lines of the subsidiary and domain. With the ambition of driving the business and delivering business value to our customers in digital transformation and data platform modernization. 

The TDM is responsible for:
 
- Is involved in Account planning, Deal reviews and monthly Rhythm of the business where we look at the pipeline as it relates to needed resource capabilities.
- Providing input and review of the staffing forecast and process, strongly collaborating with the Global Resource/Capacity Management (GRM/GCM). 
- Hires appropriate technical individuals to meet the demands of Domain head count objectives as determined by workforce planning.
- Drives team technical & professional role readiness & participates in workforce & capacity planning as appropriate for their Time-zone/Domain.
- Acting as a sponsor for our customers in several engagements and internal initiatives.
- Support in making the right impact and delivering value towards our customers.
- Drives and is responsible for billable utilization targets. 

While doing the above it’s my passion and mission to build bridges, sustain effective relationships, coaching of direct peers and individual contributors, leading plus sponsoring initiatives focused on  Mentoring (ModelCoachCare), Upskilling and Branding which enables them to develop and grow as a professional. Plus to surprise customers/people with things that they never considered possible.
profile_positions.title: Manager - Technical Delivery Manager (ISD - Azure Cloud & AI Domain)

profile_positions.description:
By being one of the drivers of the Global Azure Migration Control Center Team composition as a ACAI PjM/PgM I’m responsible for driving the achievement of the following objectives:

  - Develop a motion for driving consistently & intentionally the Azure Migration Offering opportunities across the globe with the right weight in key markets.

  - Support the forecast for pre-sales and delivery capacity

  - Support and Transition to the offering (when released)

  - Consistent approach to manage & support AMO motion: Secure proper execution throughout the lifecycle (ICs readiness, Delivery TQA, IP re-use, community involvement)

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior Global Principal Program/Project Manager within the Azure Cloud and AI Domain I'm responsible for successfully delivering the Microsoft Services strategic transformational engagements on a Global scale towards our customers. 

I'm involved in risk and opportunity management for the area as well as the entire IT life cycle but most critical during pre-sales, discovery and design phases, with broad focus around enterprise, industry, platform and solutions. 

And while doing the above it’s my passion and mission to build bridges, sustain effective relationships, coaching of direct peers, MACH-ers and to surprise customers/people with things that they never considered possible.
profile_positions.title: Senior Principal Program Manager (Microsoft Azure Cloud & AI Domain)

profile_positions.description:
With more and more organizations adopting the Agile Methodology we as Project or Program Managers are facing new challenges which require a different “growth” mindset and approach. To adopt and increase one’s craftmanship meeting the requirements of the changing landscape, ING initiated an Agile Project/Program Management Round Table. In which I’m representing Microsoft as a Senior Program Management SME.

Together with SME’s from ING, KLM, Vodafone and Rijksoverheid (I-Interim Rijk) under the guidance of Liselore Havermans (Assistant Professor from the VU) we address the challenges Project and Program Managers specialized in complex change programs are facing. E.G. being:

What is the role of a Pjm/PgM between the Agile way of working within project’s and program’s and the tension it creates towards the often traditional line management. 

Where does the craftsmanship lie, how can we maximize and influence the development of the role fitting the needs of the associated future PjM/PgM landscape.
profile_positions.title: Round Table Agile Project Management SME (Microsoft SI Domain)

profile_positions.description:
As a trusted advisor, the Global Services Account Delivery Manager (Services ADM), ensures their customers are making the most of their support for Mission Critical and Enhanced Application Support delivery plans to drive business value from their IT investments and cloud services as managed by Microsoft. 

The Global ADM will be responsible for delivery quality and customer satisfaction and will be involved in structuring, supporting, and overseeing deals from inception to completion, working with other members of Enhanced Support Services as well as Account and Domain aligned teams. This role works directly with field resources and customers ensuring an outstanding customer experience. 

The value that the Global ADM brings to the customer is successful implementation and operation, and hence realization of the full value of Microsoft products. 

The Global ADM must establish an internal network of stakeholders in partnership with their assigned customers to establish an understanding of the current status and the future plans for Microsoft Enhanced Support Services (Support for Mission Critical and Enhanced Application Support) offerings and delivery.

Manages customer expectations with our solutions globally, based on an end-to-end Services Delivery & Support lifecycle for a portfolio of engagements.
profile_positions.title: Global Services Account Delivery Manager - BDO (Microsoft Dutch Subsidiary)

profile_positions.description:
With the Microsoft's services team we want to empower businesses on the planet to do more and achieve more in a mobile-first, cloud-first world. To date, we’ve talked about our world view as being “mobile-first, cloud-first”. Mobility in this sense is the mobility of the experience, rather than mobility is a mobile device. 

As a Secure Infrastructure Senior Project/Program Manager I'm responsible for delivering the Microsoft Services Business within EMEA for our Hybrid and Public Cloud infrastructure and Application development solutions towards our customers. I'm involved in risk and opportunity management for the area as well as the entire IT lifecycle but most critical during pre-sales, discovery and design phases, with broad focus around enterprise, industry, platform and solutions. 

And while doing the above it’s my passion and mission to build bridges, sustain effective relationships, coaching of direct peers and MACH-ers and to surprise customers/people with things that they never considered possible.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project / Program Manager / Business Consultant (Microsoft SI Domain)

profile_positions.description:
As DMM (*Interim) for the Secure Infrastructure domain, I am responsible for managing an international team of Project Managers. In parallel I drive Microsoft’s transformation both inside (SI domain aligned) and outside (Country level and Account Delivery Team’s) of the new delivery organization. I represent Microsoft throughout the various deal phases driving customer satisfaction, Cloud consumption, Services revenue growth and profitability in close and critical partnership with Sales and Delivery. Ultimately I am responsible for the end-to-end delivery of Microsoft’s offerings within my portfolio of accounts.

Although the interim position has ended I will act as stand-in DMM and continue to drive activities related to this role.

- Help land any potential PjM related program that we come up with or that WW Readiness/SAO comes up with.

profile_positions.description:
With the Microsoft's services team we want to empower businesses on the planet to do more and achieve more in a mobile-first, cloud-first world. Let's help the business think digital and turn technology into new business value!

As a Data Insights Project Manager I'm responsible for delivering the Microsoft Services Business within EMEA for our Data Insight Platform, and IoT towards our customers. I'm involved in risk and opportunity management for the area as well as the entire IT lifecycle but most critical during pre-sales, discovery and design phases, with broad focus around enterprise, industry, platform and solutions. My duties include:

- Guide our customer during product and services sales cycle,
- Connect EPG, Services and M & O to run projects/programs that grow Microsoft's business,
- Contribute to the business strategy by providing leads towards possible opportunities plus executing practice management & risk management,
- Deliver successful solution deployments by ensuring proper business value and customer/partner satisfaction within the agreed scope,
- Increase operational excellence and encourage innovation.

And while doing the above it’s my passion and mission to build bridges, sustain effective relationships and to surprise customers/people with things that they never considered possible.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project / Program Manager / Business Consultant (Microsoft Data and AI Domain)

profile_positions.description:
The Getronics family is an ICT Services group consisting of the Getronics and Connectis brands and is owned by the AURELIUS Group, a holding company headquartered in Munich, Germany. With an extensive history that extends over 125 years, the Getronics family has approximately 6,000 employees in 18 countries across Europe, Asia Pacific & Latin America, and has a complete portfolio of integrated ICT services for the large enterprise and public sector markets. This includes Workspace, Applications, Communication, Data Centre, Cloud, Consulting, Product and Managed Services.

Getronics is the lead in the Getronics Workspace Alliance, a unique model that provides customers with a consistent IT service throughout the world, with one single point of contact and billing entity, delivering services to 90 countries. The GWA is ranked number 3 globally according to OVUM’s Managed/Maintained End-user Devices with a total of 7.4M assets.

As a Transition Manager I am responsible for transitioning and transforming international ICT outsourcing services. Special responsibility regarding defining, governing, implementing and auditing the Global Workspace Alliance standard transition model utilized by the partners across the globe.

The outsourcing programs include both the transfer of services to Getronics and the process & infrastructure optimization. The scope of the contacted services can cover service desk, workplace, communications & datacenter services. The majority of my clients are in the industry and finance market segment.

Next to setting up and directing a program I’m also involved in the sales process. In this role I’m responsible for creating, calculating & presenting outsourcing program proposals. Additional activities might include organizing & leading client workshops and executing a Due Diligence or verification.
profile_positions.title: Global Transition and Transformation Manager

profile_positions.description:
As operational manager I am responsible for the “Professional Services” department. This consists of approximately 12 employees divided into three distinct divisions: Consultancy, IT and Support. 
These divisions are responsible for:

- The formulation of an information policy and information planning at both tactical and strategic level, and translating the needs and requirements into concrete and workable solutions;
 
- Managing the project portfolio by providing insight into the progress and quality of project execution, as well as the effects of deviations from the entire project portfolio;

- Delivering the right capacity and expertise in carrying out projects in accordance with the agreements.

As operational manager, I took the leadership in managing the reorganisation of a decentralized infrastructure into one central department at Tensing International B.V.. 

In addition, I acted as the Managing Consultant for the implementation of Tensing’s product suite for various clients, took the role as Senior Supplier in various steering committees and was actively coaching junior and senior project managers.
profile_positions.title: Manager - Operational Manager Professional Services

profile_positions.description:
For over 25 years, clients across the globe have turned to Tensing for GIS and mobile workforce management solutions for enterprise mobility. We understand the competing priorities facing organizations that depend on mobile work crews including improving infrastructure asset maintenance, streamlining operations to manage rising costs, responding to increasing regulation, efficiently handling large service territories, and answering customer demand for better service.

Tensing offers powerful, comprehensive solutions to support business-critical field operations at utilities, field service organizations, and transportation and logistics firms. We specialize in delivering the Best Total Solution for every client by leveraging the flexible configuration of our standard, commercial-off-the-shelf applications to answer each organization's unique requirements.

Whether delivered on Tensing's standalone applications or based on the powerful Tensing Integrated Work Management Suite, we offer the most reliable, innovative solutions for enterprise mobility on the market today, built on the strongest platform architecture. 

As a Senior Managing Consultant within Tensing B.V. I’m responsible for managing several complex software (mobile workforce management solutions for enterprise mobility) implementation projects and programs. I’m responsible for a variety of different customers (15+ and growing) (Heineken, Koning & Hartman, Heras, Brabant Water and GEA) within my portfolio. I am involved from the pre-sales phase, up to the actual sales cycle and running the program/project end to end up until the moment that the project is handed over to support. In addition, I also monitor the customer's support questions, new change requests and manage (including HR responsibility) a team consisting of approximately 10 FTE’s.
profile_positions.title: Manager - Senior Managing Consultant

profile_positions.description:
A leading global consulting, systems integration and outsourcing company, CSC's mission is to provide customers in industry and government with solutions crafted to meet their strategic goals and enable them to profit from the advanced use of technology.

As a Transition and Transformation manager I am part of project teams that together contribute to the knowledge and experience of CSC and are responsible for the successful realization and implementation of challenging assignments for its clients on both a national and international scale.

During my time at CSC I was leading several Transitions and Transformations for customers like:

Dutch Railways
BHP Billiton
Pon Holdings
Dutch Railways
Bombardier
Albert Schweitzer Hospital
LeasePlan

Please refer to the section projects on my LinkedIn profile for more details.
profile_positions.title: Global Transition and Transformation Manager | Senior Project Manager | Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As project manager, I am responsible for several small projects within the ICT innovation framework. These projects include the nationwide implementation of the DCS and EIS applications. 

DCS is an application that makes it possible, based on GSM data, to determine the route a person has taken. EIS is an interface between various government agencies that allows for information to be requested on the appropriate person. 

I am responsible for managing the project, setting budgets and budget monitoring, preparation of work packages and communication with the customers. The final result is that the DCS application has been taken in to support. The EIS project went into production December 2007.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
After an internal survey, BOL.com's management discovered that there is very little connection with their internal stakeholders. It was also clear that many consumers did not find BOL.com innovative enough. 

In consultation with marketing colleagues, my job as Technical Marketer was to identify needs, requirements and translate these into business and functional specifications. In a period of 5 months I managed to significantly improve the relationship with internal stakeholders by facilitating daily consultation. These consultations involve meeting with the Front-End Development and IT Operations Teams to discuss the ongoing maintenance and status of releases, the implementation of processes and to manage any communication problems.  

By tracking market trends, competitive offerings, technological developments and initiating, specifying and implementing new functionalities on the site (including 1-to-1 marketing techniques), I was able to introduce new products.
profile_positions.title: Technical Marketeer

profile_positions.description:
The Content and Publishing department at Overloaded is responsible for the facilities offered via mobile phone, as well as ensuring their continuous availability to users. As department manager, I am responsible for this team and to make sure the team (10 FTE) performs and functions in the most optimal way. In this job I have three main responsibilities:

1 - Account Management:
I am responsible for the daily management of existing relationships, as well as for recruiting new clients.

2 - Support:
Through first and second line support I support customers who have questions regarding the usage or purchase of applications or games.

 3 - Quality Control Application:
As manager of the Quality Control and Applications department I am directly involved in guaranteeing and promoting the quality of our products and services.
profile_positions.title: Manager - Content and Publishing
